newsitem.title: UK: Options-Coffee vols unchanged but activity perks up.
newsitem.headline: Options-Coffee vols unchanged but activity perks up.

text.p: LIFFE coffee options volatilities were barely moved this holiday-shortened week but activity picked up slightly as futures staged a rally on Wednesday.
Traders said July coffee options volatility hovered unchanged at around 37-39 percent and at-the-money September puts at 37-38 percent and calls at 43 percent.
Coffee futures jumped by nearly four percent on Wednesday on fund and industry buying after benchmark July triggered buy-stops at above $1,730.
Further advances to above $1,750 triggered option-related short-covering. Locals sold around the $1,750 calls and hedged on the futures as the market advanced.
The futures market rose further this morning on follow-through fund buying. News Brazil's portworkers in Santos stopped work on Thursday due to salary delay helped values in the afternoon.
On Wednesday, option volume totalled a hefty 2,499 lots. Traders noted November $2,000 calls were traded at $77 against November $1,500 puts.
"Obviously, it's difficult to say what people are doing in terms of strategy," said one trader. Volatility traders were seen as sellers and, some traders said, buyers were probably taking a punt.
This morning, there was further interest in November $2,000 puts, trading at $85.
Holders of July options are taking a protection against the Brazilian frost as the cold season nears.
June and July are the frost danger months and the last severe frosts in 1994 damaged coffee trees and sent prices spiralling.
But one trader said: "People seem to be discounting it (the frost) at the moment. Vols are still reasonably cheap coming into that period."
Cocoa futures were hardly traded. -- Jalil Hamid, London newsroom +44 171 5424985
